classData.comment:
/**
     * Registers a new binding in case a matching data property does exist.
     * Otherwise, it will use the closest stateProvider with a match.
     * @param {String} componentId
     * @param {String} key
     * @param {String} value
     * @param {String} formatter
     */
classData.description: Registers a new binding in case a matching data property does exist. Otherwise, it will use the closest stateProvider with a match.

classData.comment:
/**
     * Access the closest data property inside the parent chain.
     * @param {String} key
     * @param {Neo.state.Provider} originStateProvider=this for internal usage only
     * @returns {*} value
     */
classData.description: Access the closest data property inside the parent chain.
classData.name: getData

classData.comment:
/**
     * Helper method to get the scope for a nested data property via Neo.ns() if needed.
     *
     * Example: passing the value 'foo.bar.baz' will return the bar object as the scope
     * and 'baz' as the key.
     * @param key
     * @returns {Object}
     */
classData.description:
Helper method to get the scope for a nested data property via Neo.ns() if needed.

Example: passing the value 'foo.bar.baz' will return the bar object as the scope and 'baz' as the key.
classData.name: getDataScope

classData.comment:
/**

classData.description: Extracts data variables from a given formatter string

classData.description: Returns the merged data
classData.name: getHierarchyData

classData.description: Returns a plain version of this.data. This excludes the property getters & setters.
classData.name: getPlainData

classData.description: Get the closest stateProvider inside the components parent tree
classData.name: getParent

classData.description: Access the closest store inside the VM parent chain.
classData.name: getStore

classData.comment:
/**
     * Internal method to avoid code redundancy.
     * Use setData() or setDataAtSameLevel() instead.
     *
     * Passing an originStateProvider param will try to set each key on the closest property match
     * inside the parent stateProvider chain => setData()
     * Not passing it will set all values on the stateProvider where the method gets called => setDataAtSameLevel()
     * @param {Object|String} key
     * @param {*} value
     * @param {Neo.state.Provider} [originStateProvider]
     * @protected
     */
classData.description:
Internal method to avoid code redundancy. Use setData() or setDataAtSameLevel() instead.

Passing an originStateProvider param will try to set each key on the closest property match inside the parent stateProvider chain => setData() Not passing it will set all values on the stateProvider where the method gets called => setDataAtSameLevel()
classData.name: internalSetData

classData.description: Internal convenience method to check if a binding value is supposed to match a store
classData.name: isStoreValue

classData.comment:
/**

     */
classData.description: Override this method to change the order configs are applied to this instance.

classData.comment:
/**
     * This method will assign binding values at the earliest possible point inside the component lifecycle.
     * It can not store bindings though, since child component ids most likely do not exist yet.
     * @param {Neo.component.Base} component=this.component
     */
classData.description: This method will assign binding values at the earliest possible point inside the component lifecycle. It can not store bindings though, since child component ids most likely do not exist yet.
classData.name: parseConfig

classData.comment:
/**
     * Removes all bindings for a given component id inside this stateProvider as well as inside all parent stateProviders.
     * @param {String} componentId
     */
classData.description: Removes all bindings for a given component id inside this stateProvider as well as inside all parent stateProviders.
classData.name: removeBindings

classData.comment:
/**

     * @param {Object} data data from event or null on initial call

classData.description: Resolve the formulas initially and update, when data change

params.description: data from event or null on initial call

classData.name: resolveStore

classData.comment:
/**
     * The method will assign all values to the closest stateProvider where it finds an existing key.
     * In case no match is found inside the parent chain, a new data property will get generated.
     * @param {Object|String} key
     * @param {*} value
     */
classData.description: The method will assign all values to the closest stateProvider where it finds an existing key. In case no match is found inside the parent chain, a new data property will get generated.
classData.name: setData

classData.comment:
/**
     * Use this method instead of setData() in case you want to enforce
     * setting all keys on this instance instead of looking for matches inside parent stateProviders.
     * @param {Object|String} key
     * @param {*} value
     */
classData.description: Use this method instead of setData() in case you want to enforce setting all keys on this instance instead of looking for matches inside parent stateProviders.
classData.name: setDataAtSameLevel
